column2: Maema53, 55-64 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 58 and have been dealing the menopause since age 49. With each passing year, symptoms became worse and worse.  Finally, August 2012,I was prescribed the lowest dose available (.5 mg).  The first week was good and was looking forward to happy days.  However, started experiencing swollen feet, ankles, hands, nausea like morning sickness, became extremely emotional, bloated stomach, itchiness much like hives, and sleeplessness. It made me a hot mess!  Dr. advised me to stop taking for a few days then start again.  Followed instructions and same symptoms re-appeared.  Had taken only for a month but I determined that the side effects far outweighed the benefits and stopped taking. I am not willing to sacrifice my well being for the sake of minimizing menopause. Had a "partial" hystorectomy and still have ovaries however they were tested as <.08 .. so no function at all. Although it was simple to take 1 pill per day, I took evenings so that I'd have time to deal with the side effects and not interfere with my job.  Not willing to be a Ginny pig for the sake of menopause.  Menopause won't kill me; pills can!

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had uterine cancer at age 49. I had typical pre- menopause symptoms. I had a full hysterectomy including cervix and ovaries. I immediately started having hot flashes, night sweats, trouble sleeping and dry skin and hair. I started estradiol 1mg and felt immediately different- no hot flashes, no night sweats, better sleep. But, after 3 mos. I began swelling in the lower abdomen (gaining weight) and felt sleepy and hungry all the time. I decreased the dose to .5mg but had the same problems. I went off completely and felt energetic again and lost 3 lbs. immediately. The night sweats and hotflashes also returned immediately. Not sure which symptoms are worse- now just trying to figure out how to feel good.

column2: Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Ever since started medication 1mg a day my blood pressure has been out of control. i take blood pressure meds but they have not been working since I started Estradoil. my BP is running 140-152 over 95-100

55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

About a month later I passed out again.  Taken by ambulance to hospital again. More tests run.  All have come back fine.  I found out online about this drug having a possible side effect of fainting.  Took myself off about June 30th.  No fainting spells since.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: GaBrnEydGrl, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I take estradiol pills b/c I no longer have insurance and cannot afford to buy the hormone patches that I only had to change twice a week. Taking a pill everyday is more of a challenge, but I am grateful I can get them for $4/mo. Pills have no taste, are tiny, no side effects, and work effectively.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: lelu, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am a 40 year old whom started taking this medication after my full hysterectomy. The good things about this pill is that it immediatley helped me with the hot flashes and sweats. BUT, it made me very emotional and very tired. I can't sleep well, I am bloated all the time, my ankles hurt and are swollen all the time and I consistly have headaches. I recently took myself off of this (.5mg) and I noticed a difference within a few days. I felt "alive" and happy and I actually starting sleeping. BUT, the hot flashes came back and the sweats and I felt like I had the flu. BUT, headaches have lessened and I lost 6 pounds. 6 POUNDS of nothing but water! I was off of it for over 2 weeks and the hot flashes came back and were everyday but they are getting fewer. I went back on the pill just to see and within my second week being back on it I have headaches again and feel fatigue. My ankles hurt and are so swollen! I have decided to stay off of this medication; if you can tolerate the hot flashes they will lessen over time. My recommendation is to not take this medication. I have tried GNC Menopause Vitapak and am feeling awesome! People have made comments that they can tell that I am not on the hormones anymore. I am working through the hot flashes and they are getting better. To all you women experiencing the change, please pay attention to this review and try something else before going on this medication.  "change" to be better.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: countrybelle, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had a radical hysterectomy/oopherectomy at age 28. I started taking 2mg of estradiol per drs orders and it has been a whirlwind for the last year and a half. I decreased the dose by half after gaining 20 pounds within the first month of use. Started having manic depression and anxiety. Developed kidney stones and gout. Increased dosage to original 2mg and gained another 30 pounds and headaches, arthritis, mood swings, facial hair, eye changes (can't wear contacts anymore), extreme tiredness and migraines. I could deal with all of the rest if I was the same weight I had been before. I even went to clinical weight loss clinics and could never lose more than 4 pounds after 2 different doctors.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries

column9: 34 and had total hyst for severe Endo... A patch was placed on me right after surgery which I wore for a few days... It irritated my skin and gave me a rash right at the patch site. Nothing major. Was given 2 mgs of Estradiol to take nightly. I am only 2 weeks post surgery but so far so good. I had a hard time sleeping and woke up a little panic attacky in the mornings on the patch but since switching to the pill and taking it in the morning I'm good. I might be a little moody but that could just be life as well and the ordeal I just went through. I have an occasional hot/cold/hot/cold thing going but every day its getting less and less. I remember what my mom went through after her hyst... I am grateful for this drug!

column2: Dewitzgrl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: IBLEEDBLUE, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a TVH (total vag hysterectomy) in June 2010.  They took everything: uterus, ovaries, tubes, cervix; all gone.  For 2 or 3 months following my surgery, I took Estradiol, but didn't feel a bit different.  I did gain about 18 lbs during that time frame though.  I stopped taking the estradiol and until recently, the only symptom I ever had was an occasional hot flash.  Now I have severe vaginal dryness, severe dry eyes (I cannot wear my contacts at all), my hair is noticeably thinning and gray hairs are popping up like dandelions. Absolutely NO sex drive. Facial hair and body hair is out of control; I have to set aside an hour a day for hair removal.  I'm moody, emotional.  The kicker:  I lost 50 lbs not being on the ET.  I am positive and my doctor agrees that if I go back on this or ANY estrogen therapy, I will gain weight back.  I don't know what else to do.  Going to talk to my gyn and primary care doctor about it.  Can't win for losing.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries

I haven't been on the medication very long, but I hope I don't have to take it for years.

God must been in it after 4 or 5 days i started feeling different than i ever had now i want 2 live more & enjoy life more than i ever have; also when i got up in the mornings all my life it took 3 to4 hrs. to get going i was draggy & tired just like sleep didn't do me any good & now i wake around daylight rested & wanting 2 get up & go 2 work i can't believe it myself. i still have my problems & i know it but i dont get depressed &down & out,crying & people can tell the difference without me telling them i have 2 take more than a lot of women because of my condition i take it every 5 to 6 hrs. if a working hard. i never would take depression med. i had 6 or 7 friends kill there self after starting it don't know name of it; all i can say esterdiol has been a life saver for me,i take both of them also after starting drops i got off fluid pills & feet &ankles are normal now,also phar. told me if nipples got tender 2 lower dose your boobs is starting 2 grow hope my proablems can help somebody

column9: I began taking estrogen supplement after a total hysterectomy.  I had horrible headaches the first couple of weeks.  I switched to taking it at bedtime and do not have headaches with it anymore.  Just an idea that may help someone else.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication has given me back my life at age 49 after 3 years of increasing health concerns.  I had a partial hysterectomy at age 34 due to uterine prolapse so did not have my menstrual cycle to help gage where I was in the process of menopause.  After severe blood pressure fluctuations caused me to faint several times, I had a full cardiology work up with no concerns.  I was barely dragging through my days suffering from extreme fatigue, brain fog, depression and dizziness. My blood pressure was ranging from high to low so could not take medication for high blood pressure.  My cholestorol also increased significantly.  The cardiologist sent me to an endocrinologist who finally diagnosed me and put me on estradiol.  My estrogen levels were fluctuating wildly so it was important to get several tests done.  My internist thought my levels were normal after one test so I am thankful that the endocrinologist recognized my symptoms and stuck with it.  I felt some relief on 1 mg/day but had to increase to 2 mg/day to alleviate the worst symptoms.  I am sleeping 7-8 hours a night again for the first time in 5 years.  My blood pressure is normal and stable.  I have my energy back and do not feel depressed.  The benefits outweigh the risks in order to have my life back.

I already had trouble with my weight before the surgery was now it is even harder. column9: At age 48, I had a complete hysterectomy Nov. 2005.  I started on Cenestin for 2 1/2 years, but seemed to need a higher dosage.  I asked my Dr. for a lower cost med. and am now on Estradoil, 2 mg.  I have gained 40+ pounds and now have extremely dry skin.  No night sweats or hot flashes, but the weight gain and dry skin are unbearable.  I have also noticed that I have cramps in my calves and I worry about blood clots.  I have also developed the growth of very fine hair about my face, mostly near my eyes. My Dr. says that this is impossible.  I came to WebMD hoping for validation. I found some concerning the weight gain, but not the dry skin and facial hair growth.   I guess I'll keep looking and change my hormone dosage.

column2: KathF, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I began taking estradiol after I had a hysterectomy in 1995. Since I have a family history of osteoporosis, though no symptoms myself, I continued taking it. During recovery from knee surgery earlier this year, I often forgot to take it, but once I was back on my feet, started the daily dose again. Soon after, I began having headaches - not occasionally, but every day. I had an MRI and a few other tests, and was eventually given Topamax. The neurologist I consulted said he felt I'd had migraine headaches all my life, and that they had for some reason returned. After taking Topamax for just a few days, I decided the side effect were not worth it, and so continued to struggle with the headaches. A few days ago, I ran out of the estradiol and haven't been able to get to the doctor for another prescription, so it's been four days without the estradiol. Much to my surprise, since I've taken the drug for the better part of 12 years with no difficulty, today I have no headache, for the first time in more than six months. The tight feeling in my head has simply disappeared. Time will tell, but I believe I've found the answer, and I will not ask my doctor to renew the prescription.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: pam, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had total hysterectomy two years ago and started on 1mg of Estradiol month after surgery.  Immediate improvement. Have read lots on side effects which are worrisome, but haven't, to this point, experienced any problems.  Has been very effective in controlling night sweats, mood swings.  Vaginal dryness is minimal and relieved with lubricants so I can live with that.  My quality of sleeping is most important and I sleep wonderfully 98% of the time. I did gain about 25 lbs after surgery and did not think there might be a connection to this medication until after reading other reviews on WebMD.  I went on Weight Watchers a year ago and lost 40 lbs (and still counting).
